DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Or Device Treatment COVID-19 Infection Receive Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of treatment or device received in the hospital for treatment of COVID-19.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Or Device Treat COVID-19 Infection Receive
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An object contrived for a specific purpose._Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition._An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An object contrived for a specific purpose.:Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An object contrived for a specific purpose.
Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.

Property.preferredDefinition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2022-2-15 ak Released per DW review. 2021-12-13 ak Created for Project 5 Tier 1.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An object contrived for a specific purpose._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

Concepts.definition: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

Concepts.definition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that no therapy was done or administered.

Concepts.definition: An indication that no therapy was done or administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mechanical pump which also includes a control system and an energy supply. It receives blood from the left ventricle and delivers it to the aorta, thus helping the heart to pump sufficient blood to the body.

Concepts.definition: A mechanical pump which also includes a control system and an energy supply. It receives blood from the left ventricle and delivers it to the aorta, thus helping the heart to pump sufficient blood to the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Low Flow Oxygen Therapy (e.g. nasal cannula, simple mask, face tent)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.: The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.
The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.
The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Able to have an effect on blood vessels.: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Concepts.definition: Able to have an effect on blood vessels.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which a small, battery-powered device is placed in the chest wall to transmit electrical impulses to the heart muscles to stimulate contraction.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which a small, battery-powered device is placed in the chest wall to transmit electrical impulses to the heart muscles to stimulate contraction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.: Surgery performed with the purpose of removing a thrombus.

Concepts.definition: The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.
Surgery performed with the purpose of removing a thrombus.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mechanical Component Therapeutic Hypothermia Targeting Body Temperature

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mechanical Component Therapeutic Hypothermia Targeting Body Temperature
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A device that is designed to be part of a machine.: Relating to or involved in therapy.: Abnormally low body temperature.: The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.: A measurement of the temperature of the body.

Concepts.definition: A device that is designed to be part of a machine.
Relating to or involved in therapy.
Abnormally low body temperature.
The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.
A measurement of the temperature of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatments that substitute for the blood-filtering function of the kidneys. It includes dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis), hemofiltration, and hemodiafiltration. Kidney transplant may also be considered a renal replacement therapy.

Concepts.definition: Treatments that substitute for the blood-filtering function of the kidneys. It includes dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis), hemofiltration, and hemodiafiltration. Kidney transplant may also be considered a renal replacement therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.: Treatments that substitute for the blood-filtering function of the kidneys. It includes dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis), hemofiltration, and hemodiafiltration. Kidney transplant may also be considered a renal replacement therapy.

Concepts.definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.

Treatments that substitute for the blood-filtering function of the kidneys. It includes dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis), hemofiltration, and hemodiafiltration. Kidney transplant may also be considered a renal replacement therapy.

PermissibleValues.value: Invasive management of thrombosis (surgical thrombectomy, endovascular thrombectomy, catheter-directed thrombolysis)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: The formation of a blood clot in the lumen of a vessel or heart chamber; causes include coagulation disorders and vascular endothelial injury.: The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.
The formation of a blood clot in the lumen of a vessel or heart chamber; causes include coagulation disorders and vascular endothelial injury.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Palliative care is the patient-and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Traditional models reflect abandonment of proactive treatment and a simultaneous increase in symptom control and comfort-related services, as a disease progressed in linear fashion through its course. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

Concepts.definition: The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

Concepts.definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.
The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Central Venous Access Catheter Vascular Access Device Placement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Vascular Access Device Placement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.: A procedure that involves the insertion of a catheter in a blood vessel. It is used in patients who require prolonged treatments (e.g., chemotherapy) or infusion of nutritional substances.

Concepts.definition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.
A procedure that involves the insertion of a catheter in a blood vessel. It is used in patients who require prolonged treatments (e.g., chemotherapy) or infusion of nutritional substances.

PermissibleValues.value: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation with/without return of spontaneous circulation

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart and lungs.: The measures applied for the restoration a person to life and/or consciousness. The act of resuscitation includes such components as artificial respiration and cardiac massage.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to both the heart and the lungs.
The measures applied for the restoration a person to life and/or consciousness. The act of resuscitation includes such components as artificial respiration and cardiac massage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart. : A procedure that involves the insertion of a catheter in a blood vessel. It is used in patients who require prolonged treatments (e.g., chemotherapy) or infusion of nutritional substances.

Concepts.definition: A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart.
A procedure that involves the insertion of a catheter in a blood vessel. It is used in patients who require prolonged treatments (e.g., chemotherapy) or infusion of nutritional substances.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of vasopressor agents to elevate arterial blood pressure.

Concepts.definition: The use of vasopressor agents to elevate arterial blood pressure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique that utilizes a device to pump a patient's blood outside of the body, oxygenate it, and return it to the body.

Concepts.definition: A technique that utilizes a device to pump a patient's blood outside of the body, oxygenate it, and return it to the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of mechanical ventilation procedure that uses a non-invasive means, such as a face mask or nasal mask, to deliver oxygenated air into the lungs.

Concepts.definition: A type of mechanical ventilation procedure that uses a non-invasive means, such as a face mask or nasal mask, to deliver oxygenated air into the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method to mechanically assist or replace spontaneous breathing in patients by use of a powered device that forces oxygenated air into the lungs.

Concepts.definition: A method to mechanically assist or replace spontaneous breathing in patients by use of a powered device that forces oxygenated air into the lungs.
